Shares of several technology companies are trading higher amid overall market strength on optimism that US coronavirus cases could soon leveling off. NOTE: Some names in the sector have potentially benefited from recent work-at-home trends.

Shares of several software companies are trading higher after the Senate passed a $2 trillion stimulus package in relief to the coronavirus pandemic. The coronavirus outbreak has caused many equities across sectors to be very volatile.

Shares of some technology companies are trading lower amid market volatility. Sunday's fiscal stimulus bill failed a procedural senate vote while the Fed on Monday announced stimulus measures. NOTE: Sector is mixed, with some names up for the session.
